member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.AbstractRasterDataSource
member.summary: Abstract base class for raster datasources.

remarks.para:
Abstract base class for raster datasources. It is recommended to use this as a base class for all raster datasources.
This class provides default implementation for listener registration and other common datasource methods. Subclasses only need to define their loadTile method.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.BillBoardLayer.ZOrdered
member.summary: Get the Z ordering state for this layer.
member.value: current Z ordering state. True if enabled (default).

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the Z ordering state for this layer.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the Z ordering state for this layer. When enabled, elements are ordered based on distance from the camera (using camera relative Z-coordinate) and layer ordering is not preserved. This forces the layer to be in "3D" mode. When disabled, elements are ordered as normal elements (points, lines, polygons), this is the preferred mode for normal 2D views as overlapping elements cause less visual artifacts.

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.HTTPRasterDataSource
member.summary: Base class for online tile data sources that use HTTP connection for transport.

remarks.para:
Base class for online tile data sources that use HTTP connection for transport. This class provides methods for dealing for HTTP headers, timeouts.
The class uses template scheme for tile URL generation. Various tags are replaced within the template based on actual tile being loaded.
For example: http://tile.openstreetmap.org/{zoom}/{x}/{y}.png If the tile being loaded uses zoom level 2 and x, y coordinates of 1,3 respectively, then this class load tile from following URL: http://tile.openstreetmap.org/2/1/3.png
The following tags are supported: s, zoom, x, y, xflipped, yflipped, quadkey

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.Layers
member.summary: Container for all raster and vector layers of the map view.

remarks.para: Container for all raster and vector layers of the map view. In general layer rendering order corresponds to the layer ordering, with the exception of Z-ordered layers. NMLModelLayer and Polygon3DLayer are always Z-ordered, MarkerLayer and TextLayer can be configured to be either non Z-ordered or Z-ordered. GeometryLayer is not Z-ordered.

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.MapView
member.summary: The main view class for all mapping operations.

remarks.para:
The main view class for all mapping operations. Allows the user to manipulate the map and access various related components.
Please note that as this class is derived from GLSurfaceView, it behaves differently from most Views. It is strongly recommended to NOT create multiple MapView instances in your activity, as GLSurfaceView is really a separate surface that is created and Z-ordered behind its containing window. GLSurfaceView Z ordering is different from normal view Z ordering.

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.MutableMapPos
member.summary: Map position defined using three coordinates.

remarks.para: Map position defined using three coordinates. X and y coordinates denote positions on the map, while z coordinate is height from the ground plane. Actual units for x, y and z depend on map projection. For example, in EPSG:4326 x is used for latitude and y is used for longitude. This is mutable version of MapPos class.
Default constructor. Set all coordinates to 0.

NML model on the map.
NML models can be created from Collada files directly and placed anywhere on the map or converted from KMZ files. NML models are optimized for fast loading and contain multiple levels-of-detail for faster loading and rendering. Multiple NML models can be batched together to display hundreds or thousands of simple textured objects simultaneously.

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.NMLModelDbLayer.SetLODResolutionFactor(System.Single)
member.param: - relative resolution factor for the layer. 1.0f is the default value, use larger values to make models more detailed and lower values to make them less detailed. Note that system really uses discrete levels of detail, so LOD changes are not continuous and smooth. Larger resolution factors can also cause shimmering, require more memory and take more time to process.

remarks.para: Set Level-Of-Detail resolution factor.

member.param: - estimated maximum memory footprint for any given view in bytes. If this limit is reached, models are shown using lower LODs. Suggested value depends on data, but for many data sets 20MB (20 * 1024 * 1024) is a good starting point.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.ClickTypeDetection
member.summary: Checks the state of click type detection.
member.value: true if click type detection is enabled. false otherwise.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of click type detection.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the state for click type detection. If enabled (enabled by default), clicks are categorized as normal clicks, double clicks, long clicks and dual clicks. This resolving take about 400ms, so for applications that do not require such resolving, it can be turned off.
Default background plane color.

Draw bitmap as backdrop. The bitmap will fill entire background and will not be rotated or scaled depending on camera parameters.
Draw bitmap. The bitmap will be scaled and rotated according to camera parameters.
Draw color only.

Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the current draw distance

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets a new draw distance. The higher the draw distance the more tiles can be seen, if the map is tilted. Changing the draw distance will cause the horizon to move, which means that the if the sky is set to DRAW_BITMAP, the horizon may not match up anymore. This can be corrected using setSkyOffset.
Draw nothing.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.FPSIndicator
member.summary: Checks the state of FPS indicator.
member.value: true if FPS indicator is visible, false otherwise.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of FPS indicator.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Enable/disable FPS indicator. FPS indicator displays current frame rate as overlay on top of the view. This provides rough estimate of the rendering performance and layer complexity. Note: in order this to be meaningful, continuous rendermode should be used!

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.GeneralPanningMode
member.summary: Checks the state of general panning mode.
member.value: true if general panning mode is enabled

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of general panning mode.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the state of general panning mode. In general panning mode, points under both fingers are moved to keep them in sync with finger movements. If this mode is switched off, map component tries to detect whether finger movement corresponds to rotation or scaling gesture. This provides smoother experience but less control.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.KineticPanning
member.summary: Checks the state of kinetic panning.
member.value: true if kinetic panning is enabled

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of kinetic panning.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the state of kinetic panning. Default is disabled. Kinetic panning allows the map to move automatically using the inertia of the last swipe, after the user has finished interacting with the touch screen.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.KineticRotation
member.summary: Checks the state of kinetic rotation.
member.value: true if kinetic rotation is enabled

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of kinetic rotation.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the state of kinetic rotation. Default is disabled. Kinetic rotation allows the map to rotate automatically using the inertia of the last rotation gesture.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]

Normal renderer
Planar render projection

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.PreloadFOV
member.summary: Gets the current preloading field of view value in degrees.
member.value: the current preloading field of view in degrees

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Gets the current preloading field of view value in degrees.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the current preloading field of view in degrees. If preloading is enabled, this value will determine the size of the area for which the tiles should be downloaded. Minimum value is 120 degrees, maximum value is 160 degrees. It's worth noting that the camera's vertical field of view is 90 degrees.

Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of preloading.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the state of preloading, default is disabled. Preloading allows the downloading of tiles that are not currently visible on screen, but are adjacent to ones that are. This means that the user can pan the map without immediately noticing any missing tiles.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.RasterTaskPoolSize
member.summary: Get the number of threads currently used in the raster task pool.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get the number of threads currently used in the raster task pool.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set the number of threads used in the raster task pool. More threads means more tiles are downloaded in parallel. Default is one.

Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get render projection.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set render projection. All view parameters are translated for new projection.

member.name: P:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.SeamlessHorizontalPan
member.summary: Checks the state of seamless horizontal panning.
member.value: true if seamless horizontal panning is enabled

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Checks the state of seamless horizontal panning.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the state of seamless horizontal panning, default is disabled. If enabled, the user can scroll seamlessly from the left side of the map to the right, and the other way around..

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.SetBackgroundImageBitmap(Android.Graphics.Bitmap)
member.summary: Sets a new background Image bitmap.

remarks.para: Sets a new background Image bitmap. See setBackgroundDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). It's also preferred if the bitmap was square (width == height), but this is not a requirement.

member.summary: Sets a new background plane bitmap.

remarks.para: Sets a new background plane bitmap. See setBackgroundDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). It's also preferred if the bitmap was square (width == height), but this is not a requirement.

Sets the clear color. Clear color is the first component that gets drawn. This color will visible in all empty areas of the screen. See setSkyDrawMode and setBackgroundPlaneDrawMode for details.

member.summary: Sets a new size limit for the compressed memory cache.

remarks.para: Sets a new size limit for the compressed memory cache. Compressed cache is an optional secondary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the compressed cache are stored as either JPGs or PNGs in the memory.

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.SetPersistentCachePath(System.String)
member.param: - the new persistent cache database path
member.summary: Sets a new database directory for the persistent cache.

remarks.para: Sets a new database directory for the persistent cache. Persistent cache won't work until a path is specified.

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.SetPersistentCacheSize(System.Int32)
member.param: - the new persistent cache size, in Bytes
member.summary: Sets a new size limit for the persistent cache.

remarks.para: Sets a new size limit for the persistent cache. Persistent cache is an optional tertiary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the persistent cache are stored as either JPGs or PNGs in a database in the user specified directory.

Sets a new sky bitmap. See setSkyDrawMode for details. The width and height of the bitmap must be power of two (for example: 256 * 256 or 128 * 512). In the most common use case the width of the bitmap is 4 times the height (width == 4 * height), but this is not a requirement.

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.Options.SetTextureMemoryCacheSize(System.Int32)
member.param: - the new texture cache size in bytes
member.summary: Sets a new size limit for the texture memory cache in bytes.

remarks.para: Sets a new size limit for the texture memory cache in bytes. Texture cache is the primary storage for raster data, all tiles contained within the texture cache are stored as uncompressed openGL textures and can immediately be drawn to the screen. If the texture cache is not big enough to store all the visible and preloaded tiles, artifacts start to show (such as disappearing tiles). The bigger the screen and the more raster layers there are, the bigger the texture cache should be. Example: typical hdpi device (480x800) has up to 4x5 256-pixel tiles visible, depending on zoom, rotation and tilting. For 20 tiles x 256x256 pixels x 16 bits/pixel = 20 MB is minimum. NB! Preloading = true setting doubles the requirement, and each raster overlay also requires extra 20MB. Larger screens (tablets) need also extra.

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.PackagedRasterDataSource
member.summary: A raster data source that uses the map bundled in the /res/raw/ folder as a source.

remarks.para:
A raster data source that uses the map bundled in the /res/raw/ folder as a source. The request are generated based on resourceTemplate that may contain various tags.
The following tags are supported: zoom, x, y, xflipped, yflipped, quadkey
For example if, if resourceTemplate = "t{zoom}_{x}_{y}.png", then the result (for root tile) will be "/res/raw/t0_0_0.png".

member.summary: Get the data source attached to the layer.

remarks.para: Get the data source attached to the layer.

Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
Get priority of data retrieval. Default is 0.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Set priority for data retrieval. If this layer downloads data from network, this method allows to prioritize base layer by giving higher priority value to base layer and lower priority values to other layers.

member.name: M:Nutiteq.SDK.RasterLayer.FetchTile(Nutiteq.SDK.MapTile)
member.summary: Start appropriate task for fetching the requested tile.

remarks.para: Start appropriate task for fetching the requested tile. This gets called when a visible tile can't be found in any of the caches and thus must be reloaded from the source. Inheriting classes can either start a new task immediately or wait for the flush command to start all at once. NB! You need to start the task in your implementation, it is not done automatically. If you have online tiles then usually you calculate your URL (urlString) and the following line is the last one in your implementation: components.rasterTaskPool.execute(new NetFetchTileTask(tile, components, tileIdOffset, urlString));

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.StoredMapLayer
member.summary: A raster layer class that uses the SDCard a source for the map tile data.

remarks.para: A raster layer class that uses the SDCard a source for the map tile data. The map data has to be in MGMaps format. The request are generated in this manner:
path + name + "_" + zoom + "/" + tpfx + "_" + tpxy + ".mgm"
For example if: path = "/london/", name = "OpenStreetMap"
Result: /london/OpenStreetMap_0/0_0.mgm

member.name: T:Nutiteq.SDK.TMSMapLayer
member.summary: A raster layer class that uses an URL as a source for the map tile data.

remarks.para: A raster layer class that uses an URL as a source for the map tile data. The request are generated in this manner:
baseUrl + zoom + separator + x + separator + y + format
For example if: baseUrl = "http://tile.openstreetmap.org/", separator = "/", format = ".png"
"http://tile.openstreetmap.org/" + "0" + "/" + "0" + "/" + "0" + ".png"
Result: http://tile.openstreetmap.org/0/0/0.png
